questions.question: In June 2017, Saudi Arabia and Egypt broke off ties with which country over its supposed support for terrorism?
Who was the British Prime Minister at the outbreak of the Second World War?
Which nation joined NATO as its 29th member in 2017?
Due to the Nagoya Resolution, China agreed to allow Taiwan to compete separately in international sporting events under what name?
What is centralism? (Not referring to Centrism)

options.1: Concentration of power and authority in a central organization
options.2: Conforming to one single common political agenda
options.4: The grey area in the spectrum of political left and right

questions.question: Before 2016, in which other year did Donald Trump run for President?
Which former US president was nicknamed 'Teddy' after he refused to shoot a defenseless black bear?
Between 1973 to 1990, what country was ruled by dictator Augusto Pinochet?
Which of these was an official candidate in the 2017 British General Election?
Who was elected leader of the UK Labour Party in September 2015?
What country saw a world record 315 million voters turn out for elections on May 20, 1991?
